red_silver_peony.name: Red Wave-Silver Peony
red_silver_peony.description: Powerful lift. Shell ascends high into the air and opens to a gigantic mix of red peony stars and silver trails.

fluorescent_purple.name: Fluorescent Purple
fluorescent_purple.description: Neon purple peony burst that is spectacular in height and pattern break.

orange_peony.name: Orange Peony
orange_peony.description: Orange peony burst that is spectacular in height and pattern break.

green_glitter.name: Green Glitter
green_glitter.description: Powerful, gigantic, chrysanthemum of green glittering stars and a center pistil of crackle.

pink_powershell.name: Pink Powershell
pink_powershell.description: Provides a powerful pink chrysanthemum burst. Perfect idea for a gender reveal or to add a bright color to your firework shoot.

legion_of_fire.name: Legion of Fire
legion_of_fire.description: Save the best for last! #500 maximum power rack has giant assorted color-changing starbursts that fly high with awesome silver palm trees and ends in a gorgeous chrysanthemum finale.

grucci.name: Grucci Glitter
grucci.description: Huge gold willow burst with strobing red stars.

red_gold_willow.name: Red Palms with Crackle Pistil-Gold Willow
red_gold_willow.description: Huge red-gold willow burst with strobing red stars.

amatol.name: Amatol
amatol.description: Amatol is a highly explosive material made from a mixture of TNT and ammonium nitrate.

anfo.name: ANFO
anfo.description: ANFO (or AN/FO, for ammonium nitrate/fuel oil) is a widely used bulk industrial explosive.

fertilizer_bomb.name: Fertilizer Bomb
fertilizer_bomb.description: Ammonium nitrate is the fertilizer compound that can be used in explosives. This compound is not found in its pure form in the common fertilizers that are commercially available.

tnt.name: TNT
tnt.description: Though both TNT and dynamite are high explosives, there is little similarity between them. Dynamite is a stabilized form of nitroglycerin while TNT is the chemical compound trinitrotoluene.

extra_dynamite.name: 'Extra' Dynamite
extra_dynamite.description: In the United States, in 1885, the chemist Russell S. Penniman invented 'ammonium dynamite', a form of explosive that used ammonium nitrate as a substitute for the more costly nitroglycerin. Ammonium nitrate has only 85% of the chemical energy of nitroglycerin.

military_dynamite.name: Military Dynamite
military_dynamite.description: Military dynamite is a dynamite substitute, formulated without nitroglycerin.
